attacks.name: DDoS Attack
attacks.description: Distributed Denial of Service attack that overwhelms servers with traffic

steps.title: Botnet Recruitment
steps.description: Attacker creates a network of compromised computers (bots)
steps.visualization: Show multiple infected computers joining the botnet

steps.title: Target Identification
steps.description: Attacker identifies the target server or service
steps.visualization: Highlight target server with crosshairs

steps.title: Traffic Flood
steps.description: All bots simultaneously send requests to overwhelm the target
steps.visualization: Massive traffic flow from multiple sources to target

steps.title: Service Disruption
steps.description: Target server becomes unavailable due to resource exhaustion
steps.visualization: Server shows error states, legitimate users blocked

defenses.description: Implement request rate limits to prevent overwhelming traffic
Use cloud-based DDoS mitigation services (CloudFlare, AWS Shield)
Monitor and analyze traffic patterns to identify attacks early

questions.question: What is the primary goal of a DDoS attack?
questions.explanation: DDoS attacks aim to make services unavailable by overwhelming them with traffic

questions.question: What makes a DDoS attack 'distributed'?
options: It comes from many different sources
It lasts for a long time
questions.explanation: DDoS is 'distributed' because the attack traffic comes from many different sources/bots

attacks.name: Ransomware Attack
attacks.description: Malware that encrypts victim's files and demands payment for decryption

steps.title: Initial Infection
steps.description: Malware enters system through email attachment, malicious link, or exploit
steps.visualization: Show email with attachment being opened

steps.title: System Infiltration
steps.description: Ransomware establishes persistence and scans for files
steps.visualization: Malware spreading through file system

steps.title: File Encryption
steps.description: Important files are encrypted using strong cryptography
steps.visualization: Files changing from normal to locked/encrypted state

steps.title: Ransom Demand
steps.description: Ransom note displayed demanding payment for decryption key
steps.visualization: Ransom note popup with payment instructions

defenses.description: Maintain offline backups to restore files without paying ransom
Implement robust email filtering and user training
Use advanced anti-malware with behavioral analysis

questions.question: What is the main purpose of ransomware?
questions.explanation: Ransomware's primary purpose is to extort money by encrypting victims' files

attacks.name: Man-in-the-Middle Attack
attacks.description: Attacker intercepts and potentially modifies communications between two parties

steps.title: Position Establishment
steps.description: Attacker positions themselves between victim and target server
steps.visualization: Show attacker node inserted into communication path

steps.title: Traffic Interception
steps.description: All communication flows through the attacker's system
steps.visualization: Data packets routing through attacker instead of direct connection

steps.title: Data Analysis/Modification
steps.description: Attacker can read, modify, or inject new data into the communication
steps.visualization: Attacker examining and potentially altering data packets

defenses.description: Use encrypted connections to protect data in transit
Verify server certificates to detect interception attempts
Use VPN to encrypt all network traffic

questions.question: In a MITM attack, where is the attacker positioned?
questions.explanation: MITM attacks require the attacker to be positioned between the victim and target

attacks.name: SQL Injection
attacks.description: Attack that injects malicious SQL code into application queries

steps.title: Vulnerable Input Identification
steps.description: Attacker finds web form or parameter that doesn't sanitize input
steps.visualization: Highlight vulnerable input field on webpage

steps.title: Malicious Query Crafting
steps.description: Attacker crafts SQL code to manipulate database queries
steps.visualization: Show malicious SQL code being prepared

steps.title: Query Injection
steps.description: Malicious SQL is inserted into application's database query
steps.visualization: Show normal query being modified with malicious code

steps.title: Data Extraction/Manipulation
steps.description: Attacker gains unauthorized access to database information
steps.visualization: Database returning sensitive data to attacker

defenses.description: Use prepared statements to separate code from data
Validate and sanitize all user input
Database users should have minimal necessary permissions

questions.question: What is the main cause of SQL injection vulnerabilities?
questions.explanation: SQL injection occurs when user input is not properly sanitized before being used in SQL queries

attacks.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
attacks.description: Attack that injects malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users

steps.title: Vulnerable Input Discovery
steps.description: Attacker identifies input fields that don't properly sanitize user data
steps.visualization: Highlight vulnerable form fields and comment sections

steps.title: Malicious Script Crafting
steps.description: Attacker creates JavaScript payload to steal data or manipulate page
steps.visualization: Show malicious JavaScript code being prepared

steps.title: Script Injection
steps.description: Malicious script is injected into the web page through vulnerable input
steps.visualization: Script being inserted into page source code

steps.title: Victim Exploitation
steps.description: When other users visit the page, the malicious script executes in their browser
steps.visualization: Script executing in victim's browser, stealing cookies/data

defenses.description: Properly validate and sanitize all user input before displaying
Implement CSP headers to restrict script execution
Encode output data to prevent script execution
Use HttpOnly flags to prevent JavaScript access to cookies

questions.question: What makes XSS attacks dangerous?
options: They execute malicious code in victim's browser
questions.explanation: XSS attacks are dangerous because they execute malicious JavaScript in victim's browsers, potentially stealing data or performing unauthorized actions

questions.question: Which is the MOST effective defense against XSS?
questions.explanation: Input validation and output encoding are the most effective defenses as they prevent malicious scripts from being injected and executed

questions.question: What does CSP (Content Security Policy) help prevent?
questions.explanation: CSP helps prevent XSS by controlling which scripts can execute on a webpage, blocking unauthorized script sources

attacks.name: Computer Worm
attacks.description: Self-replicating malware that spreads across networks without human interaction

steps.title: Initial Infection
steps.description: Worm enters the network through vulnerable service or infected media
steps.visualization: Show worm entering first computer through network port or USB

steps.title: System Reconnaissance
steps.description: Worm scans the local network for other vulnerable systems
steps.visualization: Network scanning animation showing discovery of other hosts

steps.title: Self-Replication
steps.description: Worm copies itself to newly discovered vulnerable systems
steps.visualization: Show worm creating copies and transferring to other machines

steps.title: Network Propagation
steps.description: Process repeats exponentially as each infected host continues spreading
steps.visualization: Exponential spread animation across network topology

steps.title: Payload Execution
steps.description: Worm may execute additional malicious activities on infected systems
steps.visualization: Show various payloads executing: data theft, system damage, botnet formation

defenses.description: Isolate critical systems to limit worm propagation
Keep systems updated to close security vulnerabilities
Detect unusual network traffic patterns indicating worm activity
Deploy anti-malware with behavioral analysis capabilities
Limit network access and user privileges to reduce attack surface

questions.question: What distinguishes a worm from a virus?
questions.explanation: Unlike viruses, worms can spread automatically across networks without requiring human action like opening files

questions.question: How do worms typically discover new targets?
questions.explanation: Worms use network scanning techniques to automatically discover vulnerable systems to infect

questions.question: What is the most effective way to prevent worm outbreaks?
questions.explanation: Regular patching closes the security vulnerabilities that worms exploit to spread across networks
